page.title: 12ST.STEPHEN'S CHURCH.
page.content: {Merlin's visit}: "The Rev.Pearce gave us a lot of information-the Church dates back to 1100.There have been 49 Vicars since 1282.Also there is enough room for 230 people at the Church.There are at least 10 services in a week,and there are 50 Christenings in a year. There are 25 Weddings and 10/15 funerals a year.But the church yard is not used any more. Inside the Church there is a monument of Sir Roger Manwood.The 1720 clock is rare because it has one hand.Inside there are eight bells.We had a look at the Indian Bean tree that grows by the church gate." {Additional information from Graham, Hayley and Sharon}:200 communicants a year,20 confirmations each year.The oldest tomb is dated 1663.Maintenance costs 17,489pounds per annum(covers heating/lighting,payments to Diocese.
